description: This is one of my favorite players to listen through on the Linux side. If you build a solid music library with good metadata, the experience using this is excellent.
Frictionless music player with tons of bells and whistles. Recommended!
This is a great self-hosted music app. Plex has greatly improved their music experience with this app.
Unable to test the functionality

This is a mobile app, with its focus entirely on mobile use.
It's completely impractical on desktop, and way inferior than regular Plex.
Unfortunate, as it provides more features than regular music section of plex.
I love it, it's the same as the app on my iPhone. Works grate on Kubuntu 21.04.

Thanks for creating this flatpak, the AppImage is straight up broken on a ton of Linux installations I've had but this has been a saving grace. Working great on my current openSUSE/KDE Plasma setup. Now if only PlexAmp would allow for keyboard navigation I'd be a real happy camper.
It has great graphics design, and it can stream the Tidal music better than every other player on linux. Nice work!

I use and love Plexamp on my phone all the time; it's a great experience for your self-hosted music collection if you have Plex Pass. However, this desktop app feels… not quite there. It is an exact copy of the mobile app, for better and worse. It’s lacking a window frame, rounded corners, or even window controls; the design is clearly made for a portrait phone even when scaled up to desktop sizes; and app navigation is awkward without Android’s back button. I’d also love to see the "Track system theme" option work with the FreeDesktop preference on elementary OS and GNOME 42+.
summary: Love Plexamp, but the desktop app is just okay

description: Is it possible to stream only local music? As I don't want to get Plex pass and I already have some 34000 songs on my server.
Fully-featured, beautiful, and an amazing listening experience. Hands down, the best way to experience your personal music library
As I make the jump, I'm glad to see that Plexamp is available on Linux, and that it works just as well as it does on Windows & Mac. Way to go Plex 🙌🏻️

I use it on Android and Linux. Nice basic, opinionated player that plays well with my DACs, gives access to my personal music library from almost anywhere, including master 24 bit/352.8kHz FLACs and playlists. Excellent connectivity/casting capability over LAN. Has gapless playback!! Speaking of device connectivity and gapless, TIDAL fails on both counts, but TIDAL with Plexamp makes up for these deficiencies. I wouldn't consider TIDAL without Plexamp.

Great experience of using it, clean ui.
Sadly the ui doesn't scale well to a larger size, it also is a bit clunky in navigation. 
However the ease of use makes up for that
Sign in with browser doesnt work, but other than that it's great.
This App is the way to go if you really want to self host your own music.

The idea is fantastic and when you install all looks great but if you place it in full screen you will never be able to resize trhe app.
Such a shame there is a lack of simple control as the intention is fantastic.

Please some one fix this, been waiting 2 years now
summary: lack of window control make it a frustrating experiance

description: I love how I can have this on any device. But the cherry really is the sonic features. When you have a beefy library, full of songs you've not heard for a while, it can be a really nice way of rediscovering music while listening to the bits you have on repeat. Perfection.
summary: The best looking with sonic smarts

description: This is my go-to music app on multiple devices, various OSes. It's been reliable, easy to use and keeps getting updated with better features.

It used to work fine on Wayland, but it won't even launch anymore. The Plex Media Client is borked for Wayland too. It's unfortunate because I love both media players. Both work fine on X11 though but no way I'm switching back.

I ripped my CDs and made them available on my private Plex server. Plexamp is a great client to listen and (re-) discover my own music.

My only small gripe is that it disables regular window decorations - why is this even allowed? - and I cannot fix that on wayland. On X, I used devilspie but there is no equivalent for wayland.

Just a direct port of the Android app, apparently - only recommended if you have a touchscreen. Keyboard navigation is pretty nonexistent except for ESC for back. Global media hotkeys under Gnome aren't picked up. It looks pretty at least...
summary: Better than nothing but not a great experience

description: Not sure exactly what the issue is but it crashes immediately on start for me. It was working again after an update a few weeks ago and has gone back to crashing upon start after another update. Hoping this gets resolved.

Plays music great. Looks great.

But, it have no window/title bar. How do I move this app around? How do I close it?

Plexamp beautifully lets me display and control the music from any other computer, phone or tablet with Plexamp installed. I do have a premium account and a Plex server with 34,336 tracks of music. Plexamp on my phone can access my server when i'm off network even.

I use plexamp on my steam deck and when it works its awesome.
However, it will often not respond to inputs. I've had it start up working fine and then stop working a few seconds later. on desktop mode it functions great but when launched from game mode it will often lock up and not work. it shows up as a place to cast to from my phone but it will not accept connections.
I hope it will get fixed sometime soon as i love using plexamp on my main pc.

Takes a bit of effort to set up your own server and reestablish ownership of your music library, but once you do, Plexamp is hand down the best music player out there. Playlists, offline support, visualisations, play history, flac support... I can't think of anything else I want in a music player.

Except the media buttons on my keyboard don't work on linux. Probably a me thing tho.
Doesn't work with amd radeon 7800xt
My favorite Player that I exclusively used the last ?three? years. Does all I want in a nice unobtrusive way
Дальше логина и пароля не пропускает. Войти через почту не удалось.
